intro: Lantana camara var. sanguinea, commonly known as red lantana, is a flowering shrub native to the Americas. It features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to red, depending on the stage of bloom. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are dark green in color. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil types. Due to its ornamental value, it is widely cultivated but can become invasive in certain regions.
